data.title: contact
data.text:
ADEM

Ateliers d’Ethno-Musicologie (Ethnomusicology Workshops), Geneva.

Center for the performance and teaching of expressive arts, music and dance across cultures. Founded and directed by ethnomusicologist

Laurent AUBERT

who is also the chief editor of the yearly Cahiers de Musique Traditionnelle.

www.adem.ch

ALIAS

Dance company, Geneva. Features great performers who have gone solo, such as Kylie WALTERS.

http://www.alias-cie.ch

ALEXANDER, Neil

US photographer and documentary film- maker. Worked with Kevin McCAFFREY during Katrina

http://www.findingthuy.com/CONTACT.htm

http://www.indiepixfilms.com/promo/katrina/katrina/bios.html

ALTMAN, Robert

Altman’s approach of narration, staging several parallel stories and linking them through triggering events,

while developing montage techniques to finalize these stories.

This work make him an inspiring master in the context of my research project. Also see Sergei EISENSTEIN.

ALVAREZ, Gabriel

Founder and director of the Théâtre Galpón, Geneva, Alvarez previously founded the CITA (Cientro de Investigacion Teatral de Aragon),

and his current working project, the SAT (Studio d’Action Théâtrale), in Geneva .

www.galpon.ch

www.cita.ch

http://www.cita.ch/colaboradores.htm

AM STRAM GRAM

Theatre for children, founded and directed by Dominique CATTON, Geneva

www.amstramgram.ch

APPARTENANCES

Group of ethnotherapists, who work with people in migration, refugees and asylum seekers in Lausanne, Switzerland.

Founders are François Fleury, Jean-Claude Métraux and Amilcar Ciola.

www.appartenances.ch

APTER, Norbert

Humanist psychodramatist and psychotherapist

www.odef.ch

ARPIN, Jessica

Circus and street artist; producer. Canada, Nunavut, Brazil, Italy, Greece, Switzerland.

www.jessicaarpin.com

ARTAUD, Antonin

See work by Geneva comedienne Isabelle CHLADEK.

www.antoninartaud.org/home.html

www.theatrehistory.com/french/artaud001.html

ARTISTI IN PIAZZA

Enrico PARTISANI, director ; talent-scout and artists’ manager

http://artistiinpiazza.com/2008

AUBERT, Vincent

Comedian and clown, Geneva.

http://www.comedien.ch/f/23/fiche_comedien.php

http://www.scenesmagazine.com/spip.php?article1068

AUFAIR, Maurice

Actor and founding member of the Théâtre de Carouge, Geneva, a legendary place and experimental group, since the 1960s.

www.theatredecarouge-geneve.ch

http://www.comedien.ch/f/25/fiche_comedien.php

FARQUET Karin & Jean-Luc

Karen organizes a Open Studio event for visual arts, once every three years in Geneva and area; Jean-Luc is a comedian and an visual artist.

http://www.apo-geneve.ch

http://www.scenesmagazine.com/spip.php?article808

FÉRAL, Josette

Theater scholar and teacher at the University of Québec in Montreal (UQAM).

A prolific writer who documents the methods and training of directors and actors. Also an ISTA collaborator.

http://www.josette-feral.org

FONTANA, Laurent Dominique

Sculptor in Geneva.

http://www.sculpture.ch

http://www.sculpture.ch/agenda-expositions-concours.htm

FOOTSBARN TRAVELING THEATRE

Among the co-founders, Paddy HAYTER & Joe CUNNIGHAM are still here.

Other co-founders include the brothers David and Steve JOHNSTON,

Margarete BIEREYE who founded Ton und Kirschen with David in Germany

and Pureza LEITE who founded Teatro ao Largo with Steve in Portugal.

www.footsbarn.com

http://www.tonundkirschen.de

http://www.teatroaolargo.com

FOWLEY Jr. Douglas

Irish-American actor and director, Geneva. A voice specialist.

http://www.douglasfowleyjr.com

When there’s a Jr., you wonder who the Sr. is:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_Fowley

FRASCAROLO, Armand

Italian painter, in Geneva

http://armandfrascarolo.blog.tdg.ch/album/portrait

FREEDMAN, David

Founder and director of WWOZ radio station, New Orleans

www.wwoz.org

LA CHINA, Ana

Flamenca dancer. Also see collaboration with Ravi Shankar MISHRA and producer Astrid STIERLIN, From Benares to Jerez:

http://www.adem.ch/analachina/home.html

http://www.ballet.co.uk/magazines/yr_02/sep02/rj_rev_flamenco_khatak_1101.htm

LAUGHTER

The king (who wanted to kill his jester):

You are so clever. You certainly know when you are going to die.

The buffoon: … three days before your Majesty.

http://encyclopedia2.thefreedictionary.com/buffoon

http://www.comedycentral.com

British, American, and you go hunt for more … with a grain of salt.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Python

http://www.fawltysite.net

LEABHART, Thomas

Mime and actor, disciple of Etienne Decroux and heir of this tradition. Chief-editor of The Mime Journal and ISTA collaborator.

www.theater.pomona.edu/mime/index.html

LOUISIANA MUSIC FACTORY

Managed by Barry SMITH and Linda ABBOTT. Whole Louisiana music store.

www.louisianamusicfactory.com

LOUP, THEATRE & FANFARE DU

Amazing group of actors and musicians, in Geneva. Contact with co-founder Sandro ROSSETTI,

comedian and double-bass player and architect.

http://www.theatreduloup.ch

http://www.fanfareduloup.ch

LU, Francis

Chinese-American cultural psychiatrist at UCLA, Los Angeles; among his generous involvements,

Francis got interested in methods of narration in cinema.

http://www.francislumd.com

http://www.francislumd.com/publications/IkiruJTP2006.pdf

PANIGRAHI, Sanjukta & Ragunath

Dance and music masters from Orissa, India. Sanjukta, a co-founder of ISTA, with Eugenio BARBA,

was a founder of the Odissi dance form tradition; husband Ragunath, a composer,

singer and harmonium player has also contributed research with ISTA.

http://www.rediff.com/news/jun/24sanju3.htm

http://www.absoluteastronomy.com/topics/Sanjukta_Panigrahi

http://books.google.com/books?id=31WqQLGeXRIC&pg=PA21&dq=sanjukta+panigrahi

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9qfFzBQ887g

PARAVENTO, Teatro

Founded and directed by David Matthäus ZURBUCHEN and Miguel Angel CIENFUEGO, in Locarno, Switzerland.

Paravento keeps alive the Commedia Dell’Arte tradition,

exploring a repertory that they regularly perform both in local venues in Ticino and on tour.

They also collaborate with the Kyogen Theatre, in Tokyo, Japan.

www.teatro-paravento.ch

PARFUMERIE, La

Theater center in Geneva.

http://www.laparfumerie.ch/@/index.php?page=historique

PASTERNAK, Michael

Teacher in performing arts at Geneva’s International School.

http://www.ista.co.uk/whats-on-offer/publications/whats-the-issue

PAVIS, Patrice

Theater semeiologist, Paris.

http://www.theatre.indiana.edu/guests/bio/pavis.html

http://www.kent.ac.uk/sdfva/drama/staff/p_pavis.html

PEARSON, Mike

Welsh co-founder of CPR and a specialist in theatre archaeology

http://books.google.com/books?id=_YPTVFnwLv0C&printsec=frontcover&dq=mike+pearson#PPA1958,M1

http://books.google.com/books?id=GmqFAAAAIAAJ&q=mike+pearson&dq=mike+pearson&pgis=1

PERFUMES  TRADITIONS & ARTISANS

A long-time hobby, making my own perfumes with scents, mysteries and intimacies.

New Orleans

http://www.neworleansperfume.com

http://hoveparfumeur.com

…and more

http://nematinternational.com

http://hamptonct.com

http://internet.boticario.com.br/portal/site/internetpt

PHELAN, Peggy

American feminist scholar, a co-founder of Performance Studies international (Psi).

http://english.stanford.edu/bio.php?name_id=244

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peggy_Phelan

http://books.google.com/books?as_auth=Peggy+Phelan&source=an&ei=wC6cSeiVGIaS_gbNiuGgBQ&sa=X&oi=book_group&resnum=4&ct=title&cad=author-navigational

POLITICS

These sites were brought to my attention in times of Republican tyranny,

by my friend and colleague Robert LEON and his wife Lee, both keen Democrats.

http://moveon.org

http://www.truthout.org

http://lonestaricon.com

PORRAS, Omar

Innovative theater director, from Colombia, who started in a squat in Geneva with a production of Dürenmatt’s The Visit of the Old Lady;

emphasis on the actor’s work with masks.

www.malandro.ch

PR

Performance Research, a theater and performance journal elaborated and published by the CPR (Centre for Performance Research),

Aberywstwyth, Wales, UK.

www.thecpr.org.uk

PSi

Performance Studies international

Founded by Richard SCHECHNER and Peggy PHELAN.

www.psi-web.org

RADIO

Get here and then, you’ll just never stop finding exciting stations to listen to, while working or browsing.

http://www.live365.com

RAJENDRA, Niruprama & Rajendra

Baratha natyam and kathak dancers, whom Sujatha VENKATESH invited to perform and run workshops in Geneva.

http://video.webindia123.com/dance/kathak/introduction/index.htm

http://www.narthaki.com/info/prv08/prv182.html

RECHTMANN, Richard

Cultural psychiatrist and chief-editor of L’Evolution Psychiatrique, Paris.

http://psydoc-fr.broca.inserm.fr/bibliothq/revues/EvolPsy/EvolpsyCR.html

http://library.georgetown.edu/newjour/e/msg03212.html

http://editions.flammarion.com/Peoples_Detail.cfm?ID=108888&levelCode=sciences

REYMOND, Patrick, aka DEYRMON

Visual artist, Geneva

http://www.espacemattom.com/site_espace_mattom/Bienvenue.html

http://www.salamandre.net

ROBERT, Marcel

Theater director, a pioneer of experimental theater in Geneva, and the one who introduced Balinese shadow puppet theater, wayang kulit

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wayang_Kulit

ROBERTS, Steve

English-born luthier (instrument-maker) in Geneva.

http://www.flying-v.ch/roberts/index.html

Also works at:

http://www.servette-music.ch

ROCHAT, Charles Henry

Urologist and surgeon in Geneva, involved in humanitarian projects abroad.

http://www.gfmer.ch/Medical_education_En/Rochat.html

ROCK’N’BOWL

One of the many hot places for music in New Orleans, John BLANCHER, manager.

www.rockandbowl.com

ROLLE, Pierre-Alain

Puppeteer, Switzerland

http://www.theater.ch/leguignolaroulettes

http://www.guignol.ch/guignols/presse.pdf

ROOSE-EVANS, James

Author of Experimental Theatre, from Stanislavski to Peter Brook) at Routledge, London.

A must for an excellent survey of this period.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Roose-Evans

ROUSSEAU, Cécile

Cultural psychiatrist and visual artist at McGill, Montreal.

http://www.mcgill.ca/trauma-globalhealth/people/canada/rousseau

Michel ROSSY

Actor and director, Geneva.

http://www.comedien.ch/f/633/fiche_comedien.php

RUCKERT, Felix

Former Pina BAUSCH collaborator. Came to Geneva’s La Bâtie with an exciting project called Hautnah (Skin near, literally).

www.felixruckert.de

WACP

World Association of Cultural Psychiatry

http://www.waculturalpsychiatry.org

http://www.wacp2009congress.org

WATERLOW, Caroline

Visual artist and dancer, who also work in therapeutic projects, in Bath, UK.

http://carolinewaterlow.co.uk

George WIEN

Among others, founder of the New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Wein

WIDMOSER, Alfred

Founder and director of the Drum & Percussion Center, Geneva

http://www.drum.ch

WINES

The wine makers from Valais, Switzerland

http://www.lesvinsduvalais.ch/fr/producteurs/index.php?idIndex=116

An artisan with graceful, poetic approaches:

Christophe ABBET in Valais, Switzerland:

http://en.wordpress.com/tag/christophe-abbet

A tradition from father Rémy BESSE,

Florian BESSE and Marie

http://www.vinbesse.ch/home.php?r=1&width=1680

Jean-Daniel MINOIA and Alice

The wines and the voice : JD is a lyrical bass singer in various operetta groups.

http://www.vernayaz.ch/vivre/culture/bellehelene/distribution

http://www.chanter.ch/web/diapason/diapason53web.pdf

The wine makers from Geneva, Switzerland

http://www.opage.ch/lesvinsdegeneve/default.html

http://www.cavedegeneve.ch/run?iset=1051&refpage=19832

The wine makers from Ticino, Switzerland

https://www.vignobles-online.ch/savoir/suisse/tessin/ti_general.html

http://www.schubiweine.ch/wein_detail-k10-i5511-schweiz-ti-shop.html

WPA

World Psychiatric Association

www.wpanet.org
